title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 922.19 - Extension of time
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 922.19 - Extension of time

State Regulations

In the case of a boiler or steam reservoir not in
continuous service, and where satisfactory proof of this is made, an extension
of time may be granted for the removal of flues and lagging, removal of caps
from flexible staybolts, for giving hydrostatic tests, and for washing the
boiler or steam reservoir and cleaning the water glass and gauge cocks. The
said extension of time is not to exceed the number of days the boiler or steam
reservoir is out of service. No extension of time will be granted when the
boiler or steam reservoir is out of service less than 10 consecutive
days. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17

922.19

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
